column4: i want some software to help me set goals and deadlines and track progress, does anyone know of something like that?
Do you want a full project planner with gant charts or something simpler?
this is just for me to get my life in order, so I don't need very full features
I'm not sure but I think the 'evolution' mail client that comes installed by default has a todo list
well i would like something a little more than a todo list.  I want to set goals with deadlines otherwise I will procrastinate too much
Hmm not sure, it's still worth looking at evolution to see if it has stuff for prioritising and putting dates on the todo stuff - I suspect it does
Try cleaning all your dot files out while you are in the failsafe gnome - it sounds like there is something in one of the .gnome start up files it doesn't like
hey, i restarted, i was having trouble getting into my desktop (without failsafe gnome).  which dot files should I get rid of?  should i rm -rf .gnome .gnome2 .gnome_private ?
Yeh I'd go for all of those - but instead of rm'ing them move them into another directory in case you want bits of them
any other things I should move?
See if those work, if they don't then try .gconf and .gconfd
ok i still can't get it to load.  by the way, I have a lot of different DE / WMs and I can't load any of them.  Xfce, fluxbox, etc.   except this "Failsafe gnome"
so I doubt the problem is any gnome-specific files
OK then look in your .xsession-errors to see if there is anything that gives any suggestion of the problem
fatal server error, no screens found
Odd; also look in /var/log/Xorg.0.log to see if there is anything then
http://pastebin.ca/743889
any ideas?  I looked in /var/log/Xorg.0.log but don't see anything obvious.  there is a lot of crap in there though
So you are getting the normal login screen but it only fails after login?  Have you got anything like a .xserverrc or the like in your home directory?
that is correct, I try to login through gdm, and it changes the background color to human, with only the mouse cursor on screen. then it waits a bit, then goes back to gdm
i don't have any ~/.xserverrc
i still can't get this to load :-(
